title: Downies prediction of Vote of No Confidence

content.question: Which of the following would have been the most effective way to prevent the Callaghan government from falling in a vote of no confidence?

choices.label: Mr. Callaghan could have promoted legislation to stop the unions from protesting.
Mr. Callaghan could have reached out to members of the Conservative Party to seek policy compromises.
Mr. Callaghan could have worked closer with members of the Labour Party and minor parties to earn support.
Mr. Callaghan could have asked the Queen to support his bid to remain in power.

content.answer: Mr. Callaghan could have worked closer with members of the Labour Party and minor parties to earn support.
